SENT.plain: A probable autosomal recessive mode of inheritance is described in a family with two affected sisters
The sisters showed the typical picture of Marfan syndrome and were of normal intelligence
Both parents and all four grandparents were personally examined and found to be normal
Homocystinuria was ruled out on repeated examinations
This family suggests genetic heterogeneity in Marfan syndrome and that in some rare families the mode of inheritance may be autosomal recessive
